text: The Chu (or Shu, from Chinese: ch«î) is a river in northern Kyrgyzstan and southern Kazakhstan. It is 1067 km longGreat Soviet Encyclopedia and is one of the longest rivers in Central Asia, a landlocked region. They are the homeplace of the Dungan people, who moved there during the Qing dynasty. == Sources == Category:Geography of Kyrgyzstan Category:Rivers of Kazakhstan
title: Chu River
